hypotheses.hypothesis: XGBoost and random forest models combining routine clinical indexes can predict left ventricular reverse remodeling (LVRR) in patients with dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) more accurately than logistic regression.
hypotheses.method: Comparison of XGBoost, random forest, and logistic regression models trained with clinical and laboratory data.
hypotheses.results: XGBoost and random forest achieved higher AUCs (0.8205 and 0.7989, respectively) compared to logistic regression (0.5909), indicating better performance in predicting LVRR.
